snippet: Wade M. Page, who the authorities said killed six people at a Sikh temple, was a white supremacist who performed in a racist rock band.
abstract: Wade M Page, who authorities say killed six people when he opened fire in a Sikh temple in Oak Creek, Wis, has long had ties to the white supremacy movement; Page performed in a white-power rock band called End Apathy; authorities say they are treating the shooting as an act of domestic terrorism.

byline.original: By ERICA GOODE and SERGE F. KOVALESKI
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Jack Begg, James Dao, Dirk Johnson, Jennifer Preston, John Schwartz, Scott Shane, Thom Shanker, Ben Sisario and Steven Yaccino.

lead_paragraph: Wade M. Page, who the authorities said killed six people at a Sikh temple, was a white supremacist who performed in a racist rock band.

headline.seo: Wade Page Is Suspected Sikh Temple Killer
headline.main: Wisconsin Killer Fed and Was Fueled by Hate-Driven Music
headline.print_headline: A Killer Who Fed and Was Fueled by Hate
